description: You turn the ignition and your car won't start. Your dashboard light may signal a problem or a high-pitched squeal could be a clue. More ominous sounds may include sluggish cranking or loud grinding. These are all signs that could indicate something as simple as a low-charged battery to a damaged starter. Take your vehicle to certified mechanics at a reputable auto center to take care of these issues

details.description: Dash indicator light on may mean
details.options: Bad battery Bad alternator/regulator Bad connections/cables
Improper belt tension Worn/damaged belt Faulty belt tensioner Defective alternator pulley or locked shaft

review.options: Batteries need periodic inspection & cleaning to ensure proper operation
Loose or corroded cable ends may prevent your battery from charging fully

otherservices.name: Maintenance & Fluids
otherservices.snippet: Stay on top of maintenance and extend your vehicle's life, make driving safer and more enjoyable and save money in costly repairs
